title.narrative: STRENGHTENING POLICY FRAMEWORK TO SOCIAL PROTECTION SYSTEM

description.narrative: Government institutions have increased capacity to strengthen the legal and policy framework for the integrated protection of children and the social protection of children and families, in compliance with the CRC, CEDAW and CRPD., which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Adolescent Empowerment, Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Children With Disabilities, Cross Sectoral - Children With Disabilities, Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect, Reducing Child Poverty, Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, children, particularly those in situations of disadvantage, benefit from coordinated policies and programmes, have increased access to integrated social services, and have their rights increasingly monitored.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Government institutions have increased capacity to strengthen the legal and policy framework for the integrated protection ofchildren and the social protection of children and families, in compliance with the CRC, CEDAW and CRPD.

description.narrative: UNICEF supported the Undersecretary of Children for the protection of children’s rights, especially the most vulnerable children, and to improve coordination and effectiveness of policies for children and their families. UNICEF generated evidenceadvocating for the urgent implementation of a child-centred Social Protection Floor, highlightingthe growing poverty and inequality of children due to the COVID-19 pandemic. UNICEF played a key role;in the Budget Law for 2022 requiring the measurement and monitoring of public investment in children, and actively advocated for children´s rights in the Conventional Process with the Ombudsperson’s for Children Office and other UN agencies. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:19/01/2022

title.narrative: The coordination mechanism designed to the social protection system aimed at children is intersectoral.(55266)

baseline.value: The intersectoral coordination mechanism designed to the social protection system aimed at children, includes the Ministries of Social Development and Health.

target.value: 2022:The intersectoral coordination mechanism designed to the social protection system aimed at children, includes the Ministries of Social Development, Health, Education and Justice & Human Rights.

title.narrative: The coordination mechanism designed to the social protection system aimed at children is intersectoral.(55266)

baseline.value: The intersectoral coordination mechanism designed to the social protection system aimed at children, includes the Ministries of Social Development and Health.

title.narrative: Cost-effectiveness study on CCTs targeted to families implemented within the framework of social protection.(55268), Text

baseline.value: There is no cost-effective study on CCTs for families within the framework of social protection.

target.value: 2022:There are a costing study of the Social Protection Floor sensitive to children

actual.value: 2021:3 studies of Social Protection sensitive to children published
